matrix.matrixComp

Interface MatrixComputation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MatrixComputationFD, MatrixComputationSparse, MatrixComputationSparseDistributed, MatrixComputationSparseDistributedDynamic, MatrixComputationSparseDistributedDynamicSorted, MatrixComputationSparsePar

    public interface MatrixComputation
    Interface to provide the signature for the arithmetic operations that can be performed between matrices.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Matrix add(Matrix m, Matrix m1)
      Adds two matrices.
      Matrix invert(Matrix m)
      Returns the inverse or pseudo-inverse of matrix m.
      Matrix invertByCholesky(Matrix m)
      Returns the inverse computed by the Cholesky method for an arbitrary square Matrix.
      Matrix laplacian(Matrix m)
      Computes the Laplacian of a matrix La= Da - a Da(i,i)= Sum(A(j,i)) The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
      Matrix multiply(float alfa, Matrix m)
      Multiplies a matrix by a scalar value.
      Matrix multiply(Matrix m, Matrix m1)
      Multiplies two matrices.
      Matrix multiplyByTranspose(Matrix m)
      Separates the special case of multiplying a Matrix by its transpose in order to avoid creating an extra Matrix in memory.
      Matrix subtract(Matrix m, Matrix m1)
      Subtracts two matrices.
      Matrix transpose(Matrix m)
      Returns the transpose of the Matrix m.

    • Method Detail

      • transpose

        Matrix transpose(Matrix m)
        Returns the transpose of the Matrix m. M^t The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Parameters:
        m - the Matrix to transpose
        Returns:
        the transpose of the Matrix m

      • multiplyByTranspose

        Matrix multiplyByTranspose(Matrix m)
        Separates the special case of multiplying a Matrix by its transpose in order to avoid creating an extra Matrix in memory. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Parameters:
        m - the Matrix to multiply by its transpose
        Returns:
        the result of multiplying the Matrix m by its transpose

        Parameters:

        m - the matrix to multiply by the scalar value
        Returns:
        the result of multiplying a matrix by a scalar

              Matrix m1)

        m1 - the right matrix of the multiplication

      • add

         Matrix m1)
        Adds two matrices. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Parameters:

        m1 - the second summand of the addition
        Returns:
        the result of adding the two matrices

      • invert

        Matrix invert(Matrix m)
        Returns the inverse or pseudo-inverse of matrix m. The implementation is based on the Colt implementation, which uses the LU or QR method. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be inverted
        Returns:
        the inverse or pseudo-inverse of the matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the matrix m>/tt> is singular

      • invertByCholesky

        Matrix invertByCholesky(Matrix m)
        Returns the inverse computed by the Cholesky method for an arbitrary square Matrix. The implementation is based on the Colt implementation and the paper "Matrix Inversion Using Cholesky Decomposition". The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original. Matrix m is first transformed into an Hermitian Matrix in order to the Cholesky to work. When it is applicable, the Cholesky decomposition is roughly twice as efficient as the LU decomposition for solving systems of linear equations. Consider Matrix D, the Hermitian A is computed as A = D*transpose(D). Then inverse(D) = transpose(D)*inverse(A)
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be inverted
        Returns:
        the inverse

      • subtract

        Matrix subtract(Matrix m,
              Matrix m1)
        Subtracts two matrices. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Parameters:
        m - the minuend of the subtraction
        m1 - the subtrahend of the subtraction
        Returns:
        the results of subtracting two matrices

      • laplacian

        Matrix laplacian(Matrix m)
        Computes the Laplacian of a matrix La= Da - a Da(i,i)= Sum(A(j,i)) The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to compute the Laplacian
        Returns:
        the Laplacian of the matrix
